alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne and southern Kimball Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Panorama Point, or 15 miles southwest of Kimball, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne and southern Kimball Counties. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 10 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
